w:r.w:t: The teacher will teach basic descriptive animal words by using TPR, sentence frames, and vocabulary. Students will study these words and phrases:
pig, duck, horse, cow, turtle, octopus, dolphin, monkey, snake, farm, ocean, jungle, animal, tentacles, shell,
At completion of this lesson, students will be able to:
Recognize, spell, and pronounce the words for animals
Spell and pronounce common associated words
Use both sets of words in complete sentences
Words List: pig, duck, horse, cow, turtle, octopus, dolphin, monkey, snake, farm, ocean, jungle, animal, tentacles, shell, mud, mane, feather, scales, quack

-branded opener slide that the teacher will display as the student enters the classroom.

This farm has many different animals
Say phrase and then circle animals, one at a time. Encourage student to identify them.
Write/spell each animal as they are identified.
Offer opportunity for student correction by falsely identifying an animal and having the student correct.

Offer opportunity for correction by, for example, reading the phrase as, “Ducks have fur, monkeys have feathers.”
These animals live in the ocean
Circle the animals, one at a time, and signal for the student to identify them. Then write the word. Have student repeat.
Reword phrase to, “An octopus lives in the ocean.” Repeat for each animal.
Freeform “Show and Tell” Conversation Activity Slide

pig, duck, horse, cow, turtle, octopus, dolphin, monkey, snake, farm, ocean, jungle
pig, duck, horse, cow, turtle, octopus, dolphin, monkey, snake, farm

through pictures. One prompt at a time.

Word Wall Vocabulary Builder Activity – Slide 22
Students will read and spell their new words:
pig, duck, horse, cow, turtle, octopus, dolphin, monkey, snake, farm, ocean, jungle, animal, tentacles, shell, mud, mane, feather, scales, quack, hiss
Teacher will give feedback on the spelling and pronunciation of the new words.
